column3: Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/6eec1c80a624f594209a0b3bc464dfa914267574 for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu
ACK\n@Diapolo looks good on mac. Started Bitcoin-Qt with -testnet. TN-Icon showed up simultaneous with the splashscreen.\n

Works for me. ACK for after 0.8.2 release

Sidenote: This is all great and al, but can we start focusing on normal users again. Only a very small percentage of users will ever even see the testnet.
@laanwj I'm fine with your sidenode, but as I use Testnet even more often than Mainnet, I wanted to make this "perfect" ;).\n

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/725a6283d1c3545a800184cf0fe5cae46f1d2fda for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu
I don't like this direct call to a core function (GetBoolArg) in GUI code. Can you pass this as a parameter to the constructor?\n
Yes, I'll change that.\nEdit: Can you take another look?\n
Perhaps a dumb question, but do we need QWidget here? Our main window has no parent AFAIK, or is this Qt standard and we have to keep parent in here? I'm asking because it's always 0.\n
The Qt convention is to put the QWidget *parent last after the other arguments, and have it default to 0. But do keep it, just for consistency.\n
@laanwj Switched the bool with QWidget *, to match what you said :).\n
